jalse.entities

Class EntityProxies

  • java.lang.Object
    • jalse.entities.EntityProxies

  • public final class EntityProxies
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility for validating Entity subclasses and creating proxies of these. The proxies are cached for performance reasons but can be managed using this utility. It is possible to create a new uncached proxy instance with uncachedProxyOfEntity(Entity, Class).

    An entity subclass can have the following method definitions:
    1) Setting an Attribute of type (will remove if argument passed is null).
    2) Getting an Attribute of type.
    3) Getting an Entity as type.
    4) Creating a new Entity of type.
    5) Getting a Set of all of the child entities of or as type.
    6) Getting a Stream of all of the child entities of or as type.

    For an Entity proxy to be created the type be validated:
    2. All attributes types must not be primitives (can be null).
    1. Can only have super types that are (or are subclasses of) Entity.
    3. Must only contain default or annotated methods:
        a) SetAttribute
        b) GetAttribute
        c) GetEntity
        d) NewEntity
        e) GetEntities
        f) StreamEntities

    NOTE: The javadoc for the annotations provide more information about how to define the method.

    An example entity type: 
     
 public interface Ghost extends Entity {
 
         @GetAttribute("scary")
        Optional <Boolean> isScary();
 
         @SetAttribute("scary")
        void setScary(Boolean scary);
 }
 
 Entity e; // Previously created entity
 
 Ghost evilGhost = Entities.asType(e, Ghost.class);
 if (evilGhost.isScary()) {
        // AAAAAH!
 }
    Author:
    Elliot Ford
    See Also:
    proxyOfEntity(Entity, Class), ProxyCache

      • validateEntityType

        public static void validateEntityType(java.lang.Class<? extends Entity> type)
        Validates a specified Entity type according the criteria defined above. The ancestor interface Entities is considered to be invalid.
        Parameters:
        type - Entity type to validate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Entity type fails validation.
